info.description: Apache Wicket is an open source, java, component based, web application framework. With proper mark-up/logic separation, a POJO data model, and a refreshing lack of XML, Apache Wicket makes developing web-apps simple and enjoyable again. Swap the boilerplate, complex debugging and brittle code for powerful, reusable components written with plain Java and HTML.

conf.name: default
conf.description: The core project, includes the framework and basic components.

conf.name: auth
conf.description: A basic authorization package based on roles.

conf.name: datetime
conf.description: Contains date and time specific components such as a date picker

conf.name: guice
conf.description: Support project for using Google Guice with Wicket

conf.name: ioc
conf.description: Base project for IoC (aka DI) implementations such as Spring and Guice.

conf.name: jmx
conf.description: Registers JMX beans for managing things like your Wicket configuration and markup cache

conf.name: objectsize
conf.description: Utility for making better estimates of object sizes in the JVM

conf.name: spring
conf.description: Support project for using Spring with Wicket

conf.name: velocity
conf.description: Contains special components for rendering Velocity templates using Wicket components

conf.name: examples
conf.extends: default, auth, datetime, guice, ioc, jmx, objectsize, spring, velocity
conf.description: Contains a basic component reference and many examples of how to use Wicket and Wicket components, including examples for subprojects such as wicket-spring, wicket-velocity and wicket-auth-roles.
